solution.text:
Given vertices are: A(_{i}_,_{j}_), B(_{k}_,_{l}_) and C(m,_{n}_).
Since the given points are collinear, the area of the triangle formed by them must be 0
Now Using following formula:
Area = \({1\over 2}\times (x_1(y_2-y_3)+x_2(y_3-y_1)+x_3(y_1-y_2))\)
i.e., 0 = \({1\over 2}\times (_{i}_(_{l}_-_{n}_)+_{k}_(_{n}_-_{j}_)+m(_{j}_-_{l}_))\)
i.e., 0 = \({1\over 2}\times (_{i}_(_{{l-n}}_)+_{k}_(_{{n-j}}_)+m(_{{j-l}}_))\)
i.e., 0 = \({1\over 2}\times (_{{i*(l-n)}}_+_{{k*(n-j)}}_+_{{(j-l)}}_m)\)
i.e., 0 = \({1\over 2}\times (_{{(i*(l-n))+(k*(n-j))}}_+_{{(j-l)}}_m)\)
i.e., _{{-(j-l)}}_m = _{{(i*(l-n))+(k*(n-j))}}_
i.e., m = _{{trunc(-((Decimal(i)*(l-n))+(k*(n-j)))/(j-l),2)}}_
